utility.facialrecognition package¶

Submodules¶

utility.facialrecognition.encode_one module¶

encode_one.py module, task is to encode images of a particular user. it will get images from the dataset and finds the specific folder that corresponds to the user.

class utility.facialrecognition.encode_one.EncodeOne¶

Bases: object

A class to encode images of a user.

create_encodings_from_list(images_list)¶

Loops through a user images list and returns an encoding array which will be serialized to a .pickle file.

Parameters

images_list (list) – list of images paths

Returns

encodings

Return type

list

get_images_list_from_a_user(user)¶

Returns image list from a particular user dataset

Parameters

user (string) – name of the user to encode

Returns

imagePaths

Return type

list

run(user)¶

Init and runs Encode

Parameters

user (string) – user that’s being encoded

turn_encodings_to_pickle(encodings, user)¶

Create a .pickle file from encodings

Parameters

  • encodings (list) – encoding of a face

  • user (string) – user that’s being encoded

utility.facialrecognition.recognizeuserface module¶

recognize_user_face.py module, task is to read .pickle file of a user, and determine if the face is similar or not.

class utility.facialrecognition.recognizeuserface.RecognizeUserFace¶

Bases: object

A class to recognize a user’s face with the corresponding encoding.

match_input_with_pickle(pickle_data, input_encodings)¶

Match the input image with known encodings and returns true if there’s a match

Parameters

  • pickle_data (list) – face encodings from pickle file

  • input_encodings (list) – input face encodings

Returns

boolean
